concise_definition: v. 恶化, 退化, 变差

definitions.explanation_en: To become worse in quality, condition, or value over time, often due to neglect, wear, or external factors.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由于疏忽、磨损或外部因素，随着时间推移，质量、状况或价值逐渐变差。
definitions.example_en: The old bridge has deteriorated significantly due to years of exposure to saltwater and weather.
definitions.example_cn: 这座旧桥因多年暴露在盐水和恶劣天气中，已严重恶化。

definitions.explanation_en: To decline in health, mental state, or physical function, especially in the context of aging or illness.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在衰老或疾病背景下，健康、精神状态或身体功能的衰退。
definitions.example_en: After the stroke, his cognitive abilities deteriorated rapidly.
definitions.example_cn: 中风后，他的认知能力迅速衰退。

definitions.explanation_en: To worsen in terms of relationships, social conditions, or moral standards, often implying a loss of integrity or harmony.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指关系、社会状况或道德标准的恶化，常暗示正直性或和谐性的丧失。
definitions.example_en: Tensions between the two nations deteriorated after the trade dispute escalated.
definitions.example_cn: 在贸易争端升级后，两国之间的紧张关系不断恶化。

comparison.analysis: “Degrade” (贬低/退化) 通常带有更强的贬义，强调被主动降低到更低的层次或尊严，常用于环境、道德或社会地位的贬损。而 “deteriorate” 更中性，侧重于自然或被动的衰退过程，不一定涉及人为贬低。
“Decline” (衰退/下降) 可用于数量、质量、影响力等多方面的减少，常用于经济、人口或权力的下降，语义范围更广。“Deteriorate” 更强调状态的变坏，尤其指物质、健康或条件的逐步恶化，更具感官和具体性。
“Worsen” (变糟) 是最直接的同义词，常用于口语，语义简单直接，强调从好到坏的转变。“Deteriorate” 更正式，常用于书面语或专业语境，且隐含一个渐进、持续的过程，而非突然变化。
